com.microsoft.azure.management.sql

Interface ServerOperations

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ServerOperationsImpl

    public interface ServerOperations
    Represents all the operations for operating on Azure SQL Database Servers. Contains operations to: Create, Retrieve, Update, and Delete servers.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ServerGetResponse createOrUpdate(String resourceGroupName, String serverName, ServerCreateOrUpdateParameters parameters)
      Creates a new Azure SQL Database server.

      Creates a new Azure SQL Database server.
      OperationResponse delete(String resourceGroupName, String serverName)
      Returns information about an Azure SQL Database Server.

      Returns information about an Azure SQL Database Server.
      ServerGetResponse get(String resourceGroupName, String serverName)
      Returns information about an Azure SQL Database Server.

      Returns information about an Azure SQL Database Server.
      ServerListResponse list(String resourceGroupName)
      Returns information about an Azure SQL Database Server.

      Returns information about an Azure SQL Database Server.
      ServerMetricListResponse listUsages(String resourceGroupName, String serverName)
      Returns information about Azure SQL Database Server usage.
      Future<ServerMetricListResponse> listUsagesAsync(String resourceGroupName, String serverName)
      Returns information about Azure SQL Database Server usage.

    • Method Detail

      • createOrUpdate

        ServerGetResponse createOrUpdate(String resourceGroupName,
                                 String serverName,
                                 ServerCreateOrUpdateParameters parameters)
                          throws InterruptedException,
                                 ExecutionException,
                                 IOException,
                                 ServiceException
        Creates a new Azure SQL Database server.
        Parameters:
        resourceGroupName - Required. The name of the Resource Group to which the server belongs.
        serverName - Required. The name of the Azure SQL Database Server on which the database is hosted.
        parameters - Required. The required parameters for createing or updating a database.
        Returns:
        Represents the response to a Get Azure Sql Database Server request.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - Thrown when a thread is waiting, sleeping, or otherwise occupied, and the thread is interrupted, either before or during the activity. Occasionally a method may wish to test whether the current thread has been interrupted, and if so, to immediately throw this exception. The following code can be used to achieve this effect:
        ExecutionException - Thrown when attempting to retrieve the result of a task that aborted by throwing an exception. This exception can be inspected using the Throwable.getCause() method.
        IOException - Thrown if there was an error setting up tracing for the request.
        ServiceException - Thrown if an unexpected response is found.

        Future<ServerGetResponse> createOrUpdateAsync(String resourceGroupName,

      • delete

        OperationResponse delete(String resourceGroupName,
                         String serverName)
                  throws IOException,
                         ServiceException,
                         InterruptedException,
                         ExecutionException
        Returns information about an Azure SQL Database Server.
        Parameters:
        resourceGroupName - Required. The name of the Resource Group to which the server belongs.
        serverName - Required. The name of the server to delete.
        Returns:
        A standard service response including an HTTP status code and request ID.
        Throws:
        IOException - Signals that an I/O exception of some sort has occurred. This class is the general class of exceptions produced by failed or interrupted I/O operations.
        ServiceException - Thrown if an unexpected response is found.
        InterruptedException - Thrown when a thread is waiting, sleeping, or otherwise occupied, and the thread is interrupted, either before or during the activity. Occasionally a method may wish to test whether the current thread has been interrupted, and if so, to immediately throw this exception. The following code can be used to achieve this effect:
        ExecutionException - Thrown when attempting to retrieve the result of a task that aborted by throwing an exception. This exception can be inspected using the Throwable.getCause() method.
